brewery.brewery_description:
Nestled on a working farm in Tuerong, Devilbend Farm Beer Co is a fourth-generation family operation committed to the “paddock-to-pint” way of life. We grow our own hops, barley and grain right here on the Mornington Peninsula, and use rainwater in our brewing.

Beer Grows Here. Visit our tap room @ 990 Stumpy Gully Road, Tuerong VIC 3915.

beer.beer_name: The Devil Made Me Do It

beer.beer_description:
Brewed entirely with our own rainwater, estate-grown malted barley, wheat, and hops. This hoppy farmhouse Saison is a true expression of our land. Rustic, lively, and refreshingly dry. It balances floral hop character with a spicy yeast profile. A paddock-to-pint celebration of everything we grow and brew right here.

Proudly brewed for Carwyn Canvent 2025

beer.beer_name: The Devil Made Me Do It
beer.beer_description:
A collaboration with the Catfish, Fitzroy for their 12th Birthday. 

This Hazy Pale is brewed with our farm grown Pilsner & Wheat Malt, Lallemand New England Yeast & a new Hop from Clayton Farms In NZ CIP014

Zero day dry hopped, cause The Devil Made Me Do It!

items.badge_description: The Catfish loves our regulars. Thanks for being part of the fun, & for helping to make us the best beer & music bar in town! Are you visiting us from outside Melbourne? Please say Hi to us at the bar, we love making new beer friends from all over!

beer.beer_description:
The Sensitive One - Czech Pilsner (ft. Bodriggy Brewing Co.) 6.0% ABV

Smooth, soulful, and a touch nostalgic. Brewed with our mates at Bodriggy using a traditional double decoction mash, this Czech-style Pilsner shows off rich malt depth balanced by spicy Saaz bitterness. It’s expressive, full-hearted, and knows how to hit you right in the feels .Like a 90s power ballad in a glass.

user.bio: Alone in quiet places with a bottle and a song

You have a keen taste for this Belgian masterpiece. Did you know the Saison style beer was invented by Belgian farms, brewed in the Winter and served the Spring/Summer to all their workers? Well now you do! That’s 20 different Farmhouse Ales! Try 5 more for Level 5.

Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

items.checkin_comment: Extremely bready. Biscuity and clean and dry.

beer.beer_description:
The Sporty One - North German Pils (ft. King River Brewing) 5.0% ABV

Lean, crisp, and driven. This Northern-style Pilsner keeps it tight and bitter. The kind of beer that doesn’t mess around. Brewed with King River Brewing, it’s clean, assertive, and refreshingly dry. The ultimate post-knock-off lager, built for sunny arvos and serious refreshment. Water chemistry plays a big part in this style.

user.bio: Alone in quiet places with a bottle and a song

Keeping my friends close,
 but my beers closer.

items.badge_description: The power of pilsner! Part of our first round of “Super Style” badges in 2023, celebrate this crisp, clean lager, which ranked as the 10th most checked-in style of 2021 with over 1M check-ins. AVAILABLE ONLY TO UNTAPPD INSIDERS.

user.bio: Never started a beer I didn't finish.

beer.beer_description:
Crafted with Totally Pure Fruits in Red Hill. Freeze-dried blackberries, blueberries, and raspberries. 
This fruit kettle sour bursts with bold, juicy flavor. Vibrant, tart, and refreshingly punchy. 
It’s a berry-packed explosion in every sip. 
A playful collab that’s as fun and fruity as it is lip-smackingly sour. Contains Lactose.

user.bio: Work less, play more, drink better beer

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That's 455 check-ins with a photo.  Try 5 more for Level 92!
Do you come from the land down under, where beer does flow, and men chunder? That's at least 10 different beers from Australia. Try 5 more for Level 3.

beer.beer_description:
Our play on a Honey Beer in collaboration with Pure Peninsula Honey.

We chose to use their Manuka Honey in a traditional Ale, showcasing our Devilbend Pilsner Malt. This blend has yielded an easy drinking beer, with rich sweetness from the honey, balanced with savoury and herbal notes. As well as embracing all the health benefit of Manuka Honey!

While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 340 check-ins at venue that is verified.  Try 5 more for Level 69!

Honey isn’t just for the bees. Whether it's the ancient fermented concoction that combines honey, water and a variety of spices to make Mead or its the traditional beer brewing process that adds honey as an additional ingredient, your love of honey is really showing. That's 5 different beers categorized as a Mead or Honey Beer. Try 5 more for Level 2!

South Aussie living in Melbourne. Go Port Adelaide!

That's 485 checkins with the serving style of Taster. Try 5 more for Level 98! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 490 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 99.

beer.beer_description: Light and bright with tropical and herbal notes shining through.

items.checkin_comment: Not a traditional pilsner by any means but I love it

beer.beer_description:
The Bad Boy - West Coast Pils (ft. Kaiju! Beer) 5.5% ABV

Loud, rebellious, and impossible not to love. Our collab with Kaiju! Beer turns up the volume with 100% Devilbend-grown hops and the award-winning Kaiju! lager yeast that snagged them Best Lager 2025. Bright, resinous, and unapologetically hoppy. The rule breaker of the bunch, but everyone’s secretly cheering for him.

items.badge_description: What happens when you take two or more amazing breweries, throw them into the tank and let them ferment together? An amazing collaboration beer, that’s what! Cheers to working together to create the perfect flavor. That's 115 different beers that have been brewed as a collaboration. Try 5 more for Level 24!

items.checkin_comment: More biscuity than the others and very tasty

beer.beer_description:
The Sporty One - North German Pils (ft. King River Brewing) 5.0% ABV

Lean, crisp, and driven. This Northern-style Pilsner keeps it tight and bitter. The kind of beer that doesn’t mess around. Brewed with King River Brewing, it’s clean, assertive, and refreshingly dry. The ultimate post-knock-off lager, built for sunny arvos and serious refreshment. Water chemistry plays a big part in this style.

items.badge_description: Light and crisp, a Pilsner is all you need to make your day great. Though, perhaps another one would make it even better. That’s 65 different Pilsners. Try 5 more for Level 14!

beer.beer_description:
Brewed entirely with our own rainwater, estate-grown malted barley, wheat, and hops. This hoppy farmhouse Saison is a true expression of our land. Rustic, lively, and refreshingly dry. It balances floral hop character with a spicy yeast profile. A paddock-to-pint celebration of everything we grow and brew right here.

Proudly brewed for Carwyn Canvent 2025

Brewed with our farm grown pilsner malt and using the traditional triple decoction method. 

This Czech Pilsner is a rich expression of heritage and craft. Deep malt complexity meets a crisp, clean finish. Highlighting the grains full flavor. Smooth golden and refined. 

This lager is a tribute to classic technique and home grown ingredients.
Light toast character, which balances the mild bitterness before tropical hops tingle across the tongue.
Presents with refreshing sweetness, balanced by a moderate bitterness.
American IPA brewed with our hop blend "Chumbus" & Farm grown malts
Light and bright with tropical and herbal notes shining through.

This bold and beautifully crafted Triple IPA is a showcase of fresh hops grown on Devilbend Farm. A golden amber pour with a slight haze, the beer releases a vibrant burst of citrus, pine, and floral aromas, thanks to generous triple dry-hopping with Cascade, Chinook, Centennial, and Columbus hops
Mmmm
Weizen
The Little Devil Mid is a clean and crisp Lager, featuring prominent hop notes.

Our play on a Honey Beer in collaboration with Pure Peninsula Honey.

We chose to use their Manuka Honey in a traditional Ale, showcasing our Devilbend Pilsner Malt. This blend has yielded an easy drinking beer, with rich sweetness from the honey, balanced with savoury and herbal notes. As well as embracing all the health benefit of Manuka Honey!

Brewed in collaboration with Rocky Ridge, this triple decoction Maibock is a nod to old-world technique with a fresh twist.

Rich, toasty malt depth meets a delicate noble hop aroma from a light dry hop.

Smooth, full-bodied, and refined. This is tradition reimagined for the modern drinker.

GABS2024 Festival Beer - From the first pour to the last lingering sip, our Triple Decoction Open-Fermented Classic Pilsner seduces your palate with its crisp, clean profile and subtle hints of malt sweetness and noble hops. Each sip is a celebration of the brewer's art, a testament to the timeless allure of tradition in a world too often defined by haste and imitation.

beer.beer_name: The Devil Made Me Do It

Zero day dry hopped, cause The Devil Made Me Do It!
